msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.title: Genesis 37
ab.l: And Jacob dweltin the land of his father’s residences,in the land of Canaan.

This is the fateof Jacob. Joseph was seventeen years old, he was pasturing the flock with his brothers.And he was a boy with the sons of Bilhah, andwith the sons of Zilpah, his father’s wives: and Joseph broughta bad |report| of their shame to their father,that they made him a servant to the sons of Bilhah and Zilpah.
And Israel loved Joseph more than allhis sons, because he was the son with the habits of an old man. And he madehim a shirt of many patterns.
And his brothers sawthat their father loved him more than all his brothers,and they were hostile to him, and were not able speakpeacefully to him.
And Joseph had a dream,and he told it to his own brothers, and theywent on to be hostile to him even more.
And he saidto them, ‘Listen now to this dream which I dreamed:
And, lo, we were binding sheaves inthe field, and, lo, my sheaf arose and stood |upright|, too. And,lo, your sheaves stood all around and bowed down to my sheaf.’

And his brothers said to him, ‘Will you indeed reignover us? Will you rule over us according to our wish|or| by force?’ Andthey were hostile to him even more because of his dreams, andbecause of his words.
And he dreamedanother dream, and told it to his brothers, and said, ‘Lo,I have dreamed again. Lo, the sun andthe moon and the eleven stars bow down to me.’

And he told it to his father, and to his brothers. Andhis father was angry at him, and said to him, ‘What is this dreamthat you have dreamed? Will I and your mother andyour brothers indeed come to bow down to you to the earth?’
Andhis brothers envied him, but his father kept the words.
And his brothers went to pasturetheir father’s flock in Shechem.
AndIsrael said to Joseph, ‘Lo, your brothers pasturein Shechem. Come, and let me send you to them.’ And he said to him, ‘Lo,I am here, I am ready to do your words.
And he saidto him, ‘Go, see your brothers’ health,and the health of the flock, and bring me a word of answer.’And he sent him from the valley of Hebron. And he came to Shechem.
And a man met him, and, lo,he was wandering in the field. And the man asked him, saying, ‘Whatare you looking for?’
And he said, ‘I am looking for my brothers.Tell me now where are they pasturing?’
And the man said, ‘They journeyed from here. BecauseI heard them say, “Let us go to Dothan.”’ And Joseph wentafter his brothers, and found them in Dothan.
And they saw him from afar, and before he came near to them,and they had evil thoughts against him to slay him.
Andthey said one to another, ‘Behold, this master of dreams is coming †alone.
And now, come on and let us kill him and cast himinto one of the wells, and we will say that an evil beast has devoured him,and we shall see what his dreams will be.
AndReuben heard it, and he came to deliver him out of their hands. And he said,‘Let us not smite him that his soul leaves him.’

AndReuben said to them, ‘Shed no blood. Cast him into this well thatis in the wilderness, and reach no hand toward him.’ And he gave them such advicein order to rescue him out of their hands, to send him againto his father.
And it was, when Joseph came to his brothers,that they ordered Joseph to take off his shirt,the shirt of many patterns that was on him.
Andthey took him, and cast him into a well. And the well was empty,there was no water in it.

And they sat down to eatbread. And they raised their eyes and looked, and, lo,a company of Ishmaelites was coming from Gilead with their camelscarrying spices, and balm, and mastic; they were going to bringthem down to Egypt.
And Judah saidto his brothers, ‘What profit is it if we kill our brother,and conceal the shed of his blood?
Come on and let us sell him to the Ishmaelites, and let our hand not be on him,because he is our brother and our flesh.’ And his brothers listened tohis words.

And Midianite men passed by,merchants. And the brothers of Joseph pulled and liftedJoseph from the well, and sold Joseph to the Ishmaelitesfor twenty pieces of silver. And they brought Josephto Egypt.
And Reuben returned to the well, and, lo,Joseph was not in the well. And he tore his clothes.
And he returned to his brothers, and said, ‘The child is not! AndI, where shall I go?’
And they tookJoseph’s shirt, and slaughtered a kid of the goats, and dippedthe shirt in the blood.
And with swordsthey stabbed many times the shirt of many patterns, and they broughtit to their father, and said, ‘We found this. Recognizenow: is it your son’s shirt or not?’
And he recognized it, and said, ‘It is my son’s shirt. An evil beastdevoured him. Joseph is surely torn up!’
And Jacob torehis clothes, and put sackcloth on his hips, and mournedfor his son many days.
Andall his sons and all his daughters rose up to comfort him, but he did not wantcomfort, and he said, ‘Because I will go down to the mourning grave to my son.’Thus his father wept for him.
And the Midianites sold him to Egypt, to Potiphar, a vizierof Pharaoh, superior of the executioners.
